name: Table
maker: Attributed to Martin Carlin, Porcelain plaques made at Sèvres Manufactory
description: Table; Attributed to Martin Carlin (French, born Germany, about 1730 - 1785, master 1766), Porcelain plaques made at Sèvres Manufactory (French, 1756 - present); Sèvres, France; about 1770; circular plaque 1764; Oak veneered with tulipwood, ebony and holly; white marble lower shelf; set with four soft-paste porcelain plaques with polychrome enamel decoration; gilt-bronze mounts; 70.5 x 39.1 cm (27 3/4 x 15 3/8 in.); 70.DA.74; Gift of J. Paul Getty; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Table
medium: Oak veneered with tulipwood, ebony and holly; white marble lower shelf; set with four soft-paste porcelain plaques with polychrome enamel decoration; gilt-bronze mounts
